meanings.definition: Failure to fulfill an obligation, especially a financial one.
meanings.sent1: When he didn't pay back the money, it was a default on his loan.
meanings.sent2: The default on the mortgage led to serious consequences.
meanings.sent3: The default on the debt made everyone worried about his finances.
meanings.sent4: Her default on the payment was like breaking a promise.
meanings.sent5: The default on the rent payment left him in a tough situation.

meanings.definition: A preselected option adopted by a computer program or other mechanism when no alternative is specified.
meanings.sent1: The computer program automatically chose the default font.
meanings.sent2: The default setting for the printer was black and white.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally selected the default option and couldn't change it back.
meanings.sent4: The default choice for the email signature was plain and simple.
meanings.sent5: The default selection for the game level was easy for beginners.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill an obligation, especially a financial one.
meanings.sent1: She defaulted on her loan and faced serious consequences.
meanings.sent2: If you default on the payment, you may incur additional charges.
meanings.sent3: He defaulted on the promise to pay back the money.
meanings.sent4: The company defaulted on the contract, causing legal issues.
meanings.sent5: If you default on the agreement, you risk losing your assets.
